intro: Butinia glaucescens, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring woody stems and thick, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom in late summer and early fall. Its floral structure is characteristic of the Malvaceae family, with five petals and a prominent stamen. Butinia glaucescens is well-suited to hot, dry climates and is often found in rocky soils along canyons and slopes.
